explanation: The report is correct for the provided scenario. With #define OS_DEBUG(__VA_ARGS__) (i.e. the macro expands to nothing), each OS_DEBUG(...) statement becomes a null statement (a solitary ‘;’) after preprocessing. That null statement is executed but performs no action and its removal would not affect program behaviour — exactly the definition of dead code in MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.2. In particular, strerror(errno) is not evaluated when the macro expands to nothing, so the original intent of the call is eliminated and the resulting no-op is dead code. If, however, OS_DEBUG were defined to perform a runtime action (e.g. call a logging function), then there would be no violation. Given the additional code showing OS_DEBUG defined empty, the reported violation is correct.
